author: {'steamid': '76561197990913342', 'num_games_owned': 879, 'num_reviews': 193, 'playtime_forever': 383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1700925793}
review:
It's a hard review to write when the game is objectively decent but it doesn't gel with me personally. I'm going to recommend Anomaly Defenders but get it on sale($1 during this Steamsgiving sale, nice.) Maybe this will be your weird janky indie gem you enjoy. I've got quite a few of those under my belt and if it's fun to you then it's fun.

A counterpart to Anomaly Warzone, AD puts you on the side of the aliens to build towers to receive waves of invaders, as Alien God intended. Warzone games are unique in that you play the part of the invaders and swap your tactics, path, etc on the fly to adjust versus enemy fortifications but here we're back to waiting for baddies and layering killboxes to destroy them. AD has a unique approach where line of sight and tower positioning matter a lot more than usual because enemies fire at towers as they pass so you want sniper towers to be shielded by bulky towers, DPS towers to ambush units coming around corners or pillars, and to respect the order and ranges of enemies. You get a variety of powers designed to be used rapidly to maintain towers with repairs, boost critical towers to burst through problems and to shield and draw aggro during the worst of enemy punishment. This is all well and good. AD is a decent tower defense.

Tower Defense aficionados, or Rowdy Towdies as we're known, may be let down by the lack of mazing, or using your towers to build and block the enemy path. An alternative in AD is to place harvesters on predetermined resource nodes, changing AI behavior. If there are three paths and one has a harvester the AI will attempt to use it if they can reach it. This is a nice strategic layer, even in the decision to fill out every resource node to cash out fast and accept the default enemy pathing. With all that said...

AD is quite generic. It looks alright, aesthetic matches the generic sci-fi every other 3D indie tower defense of the 2010s went for, forgettable soundtrack and although I'd smooch the robot girl the voice clips repeat too often. AD is slightly stilted in a way that is hard to explain other than a vague sensation of being unimpressed. Feels like mobile game design, though it lacks monetization. The controls are limited, clicking on energy drops to gather is tedious, I wish I could rotate the camera. The thinking elements are there and the level difficulty rises smoothly enough with steady introduction of threats and features though nothing sticks out. The tower variety is feels low as it takes over 2/3 of the game to unlock them all. AD never really lets you down, it just struggles to impress, though I found the last quarter of the game to be much more fun with full tower options.

I steadily lost interest as I ground the game out, only stopping when it outright wronged me. Several levels feature a terrible random environmental hazard, which all seem to be timed damage in a circle you can react to or random stunning of your towers. Oh I get it. They threaten enemies too. You're supposed to aggressively manage your stuff, sell it briefly and recoup most of the expense or use them until right before impact and sell them, then remake them. This still feels awful enough that I imagine most players will sulkily burn most of their energy repairing through the impacts, 90% of which will never hit the enemies. I think any towdie understands the feeling: I want to set my perfect blueprint and watch it tear apart the enemy. This is a textbook example of an idea that can be executed correctly but feels bad, and of course the element of RNG is anathema to any tightly structured high difficulty part of a tower defense.

That about sums it up. I got tired of AD fast and came back to blitz it to never think about it again. It's still fine, a $5 or less title doesn't need to come at me as hard as Vampire Survivors every time. I was thoroughly whelmed by a 5 or 6 outta 10 but maybe on a good sale AD will be better than you expected.

author: {'steamid': '76561198263125501', 'num_games_owned': 295, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 469, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1698271990}
review: I find this entire series incredible.  Yet here is the thing.  For the price you should get all 5-6 of them on sale IN THE BUNDLE to boot.  Just like when you buy any other product that is the way to save MOST.  Also it is nice to have all of them as they play so differently in so many ways and yet all have that common theme/world building. You can run these on potatoes for the most part or high end systems probably even best to upscale them then at that point to 4/8k speaking of which I am going to try right now with the versions of that I own on steam (there are FREE versions as well as paid for upscalers just google it).   I recommend all of the entire series of these games 10/10.  Voice acting is excellent in each, even music.  graphics are serviceable for something that is so widely cross-compatible!  You should wish-list this series like I already mentioned, for best savings and just how small they are to fit on your sdd.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139480922', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 192, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1692909284}
review:
[h1]5/10[/h1]
[h3]Random game key: 4/152[/h3]
From my brief time playing, it's quite apparent that the maps lack the diversity needed to offer a wide range of strategic options, which is a cornerstone of tower defense games.

While I'm not an expert in this genre, I have played some I enjoyed, like Bloons TD6 and a few Kingdom Rush titles. Unfortunately, this game doesn't quite measure up to any of those. The enemies all seem pretty much the same, lacking that intriguing factor, and this holds true for the tower designs as well.

The other elements are okay, but the essential aspects that make a tower defense game captivating just don't seem to be present here. So, personally, I won't be recommending it. However, everyone's preferences differ, so if you happen to have obtained it from a random key bundle, it might be worth a shot to see if it clicks for you.

review:
> The Good
- Tower abilities add tactical depth to battle
- Puzzle-like stage designs throw lots of twists into the mix

> The Bad
- A step backward from the series' innovative gameplay
- The nuances of tower strengths vs. enemy types get lost in the chaos
- Combat grows repetitive over time

author: {'steamid': '76561198352678828', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 324, 'playtime_forever': 281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1694601363}
review: Excellent Tower Defense. Easy mode is far too easy. Personal rating 8/10 recommended

author: {'steamid': '76561197991556719', 'num_games_owned': 681, 'num_reviews': 214, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1687628866}
review:
A very mediocre tower defense game. The towers don't seem to have much oomph to them and neither do the enemy units. 
There are very few variations in towers and there are even fewer paths to take for enemies throughout a map. Not to mention the lack of variety in enemies and upgrades. Graphics aren't bad although there's this strange fish-eye lens that you're looking through and everything kind of tends to look alike.

I also find it rather annoying that when you finish a map on Hard difficulty, it still forces you to play the lower difficulties.

All-in-all it's not bad but not very satisfying either. Not recommended unless you really need a TD fix.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970416306', 'num_games_owned': 1059, 'num_reviews': 381, 'playtime_forever': 1424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1424, 'last_played': 1683486768}
review: Great tower defense game from the creators of Frostpunk. Anomaly Defense doesn't add a lot of new things to the genre, but what is does is very well designed. There's a decent amount of towers and perks, which can be upgraded with points you earn during each mission. The money you need to build towers isn't only earned by killing enemies, but also by placing harvesters on resource locations on the playfield. Protecting these harvesters against enemy attacks is an important part of the gameplay. The replayability is rather low, but I had tons of fun with the many missions the game has to offer. Very recommended!

review:

I have played all the Anomaly games and I can easily say this is my favorite.

author: {'steamid': '76561198963046802', 'num_games_owned': 141, 'num_reviews': 147, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1675520336}
review:
If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if your're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:
1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:
1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198848966987', 'num_games_owned': 853, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 696, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 696, 'last_played': 1672203974}
review:
Como Ãºltima entrega de la saga Anomaly se puede decir que posee algunos puntos fuertes y otros... no tanto.. En Anomaly Defenders se presenta un "nuevo enfoque" para la franquicia, porque las obras anteriores eran juegos de estrategia en tiempo real/defensa de torres en donde el papel del jugador se centraba realmente en el "ataque a las torres" en una batalla contra las fuerzas extraterrestres que intentaban apoderarse del planeta. 

Y ahora nos encontramos del otro lado de la orilla, siendo nuestro papel "ser las torres" para repeler las fuerzas militares humanas que... [Mini spoiler:] [spoiler] Con lo sucedido en los finales de Anomaly 2, los humanos se hicieron de "nuevas cosas" que claramente representaron un avance para su resurgimiento como civilizaciÃ³n, y que ahora han llevado la pelea a los dominios del espacio como LOS atacantes directos. [/spoiler]

Es por este apartado en donde se habla de algo "nuevo" para la franquicia, PERO en cambio, pasa a ser un "TowerDefense de toda la vida", dejando a un lado el valor aÃ±adido que tuvo en su dÃ­a al traer una nueva manera de jugar.

Visualmente tiene presencia propia, a la vez que familiaridad en relaciÃ³n a sus otras entregas.
Sonoramente con en efectos o mÃºsica, cumple.
Jugablemente no es tan dinÃ¡mico... y es que al ser una continuaciÃ³n directa a Anomaly 2, con todo lo que aporto, mejorÃ³ y propuso esa segunda entrega en su momento; aquÃ­ se sienten algunos pasos atrÃ¡s. No a grandes rasgos, pero definitivamente el ritmo de juego cambia y por ende su experiencia.
La progresiÃ³n del juego al menos es mÃ¡s amigable con el jugador, con un Ã¡rbol de habilidades que se puede resetear segÃºn convenga para la misiÃ³n.
No es un mal juego, pero no llega a innovar de manera considerable al modelo tradicional de los T.D.

Y ya, es un recomendado (en rebajas obviamente) mÃ¡s por el hecho de conocer la conclusiÃ³n de la saga, pese a su aporte casi mÃ­nimo, incluso desde la nueva perspectiva.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034402756', 'num_games_owned': 3370, 'num_reviews': 368, 'playtime_forever': 5378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5378, 'last_played': 1654869756}
review:
Fixed points Tower Defense with both very good and not so good aspects. Definitely worth a playthrough on any difficulty. 

[h2]Reversed roles from the predecessors [/h2]
In Anomaly 1 & 2 you have to guide human invaders through a path with towers shooting down on you. In this final installment of that series you are on the other side, building and buffing the towers! Buffing as in healing, enraging, shielding, EMP-ing, exploding, or giving them sniper range. Buffing costs energy, which is dropped by enemies upon destruction. The towers can be constructed through spending the currency of the game called Carusaurum, which can be harvested on several spots per level over time. The harvesters attract the majority of the attacks, and influences the pathing of the humans, but only if the harvester stays above half their hitpoints, or else it goes in lockdown and stops functioning. 

Every level has an easy, normal and a hard mode. The difference is in the difficulty of the enemies, the amount of buildspots, and the amount of tech points awarded. The latter can be reduced if you allow the enemies to damage your launchpad at the end of the level. The tech points can be invested between levels to unlock new towers, abilities, perks, or upgrades of these. Every tower can be three times upgraded, and during upgrading the tower remains functioning. The new technologies are unlocked after certain levels, which synchronises roughly with your ability to buy them. You never will be able to buy every technology, but you can reallocate your technologies at any time. And finally you have a buffing tower that can either restore health, boost range or dps. 

[h3]The good:[/h3]
- it looks good. 
- very well balanced. 
- great selection of towers and technologies. 
- good sound effects, music and voice. 

[h3]The bad:[/h3]
- fixed and limited building spots. Especially on hard mode there isn't any freedom in tower placement, and it limits in techniques you can apply, and makes you have to:
- babysit towers. In most hard levels I found myself constantly feeding the same towers with rage and snipe, constantly using pause. 
- in theory there are lots of pathing ways, but since you can't manually disable harvesters, they only avertedly take the wrong path because you failed to heal a harvester in lockdown, oops! Only on the final level I didn't build a certain harvester in order to force enemies one way. Selling a harvester destroys the harvest spot, but let's you build a tower on that spot, I'm not sure the developers intended this. 
- sometimes you have multiple locations under fire, and since you can't zoom out you have to go there manually. Not ideal. 

[h2]Conclusion [/h2]
This is a nice game to play through, although I'm not a fan of severely limiting the possible building spots. And because of this you have to concentrate on the most versatile towers: Behemoths for ground units, and Stormers for the air. I would love to use every single tower, but it's simply pointless... Constantly having to feed towers buffs isn't great design either. And I personally don't like my towers to be attacked at all, but that's just a style. Clicking energy bubbles, a clicker mechanic I rather not see in my TD's. 

But overall nice game. 

70/100

author: {'steamid': '76561198001180333', 'num_games_owned': 771, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1647637663}
review:
A fun game with deep irony.

Fight as the Aliens in the Anomaly series & this time, you're the defenders.

If you've never played the Anomaly series, you control the humans in a reverse game mode (Tower Offense).  As Humans you're the attackers & kill the Aliens to win the game.  In Anomaly Defenders, you play as the Aliens & this time you get to Defend.  Same Conflict, New Perspective... Or so they say...  

When you're the Humans in Anomaly, to win you kill Aliens.  So a different perspective would be as Aliens being killed by Humans.  SOOOOO.... to win as Aliens you would need to lose right?  Wrong.  Kill all Humans, Defend your base with 0% damage taken but somehow the Humans still progress all the way to the end base....  Oh the irony...

Loads more fun than the other Anomaly games btw

author: {'steamid': '76561198036603218', 'num_games_owned': 1317, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 738, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 738, 'last_played': 1642997293}
review:
[h1] Great Spin on the Anomaly Series [/h1]
Anomaly Defenders is a really fun spin on the series and welcome addition.  Instead of navigating the TD gauntlet, you are now in charge of the TD itself.  

This title has all the familiar units and towers of the series, but it's very enjoyable playing this side of the game.  They do introduce some new units and being in charge of the towers you get access to a tech tree and abilities to customize how you will approach each level.  I spent more than triple the time on this installment than the previous two titles.  I found myself replaying levels for that â€˜perfectâ€™ completion score and trying different strategies.

[b]Sound â€“[/b] Great for what it is.  It's all the sounds from the series and does what it should.  Voice acting leaves something to be desired but it doesnâ€™t hurt the game any.

[b]Graphics â€“[/b] For an 8-year-old game, you can't really want or expect more.  It's good enough that I didnâ€™t feel like I was playing an old game because TDâ€™s just donâ€™t demand much.

[b]Gameplay â€“[/b] I enjoyed the tech tree and customization.  Allows you to approach each level however you want.  As far as TDâ€™s go, it's pretty straightforward.  

[b]Replay Value â€“[/b] It's got some.  You can change your tech and strategy.  You can change difficulty levels which changes the mission map, meaning each difficulty is a different map.  

[b]Story â€“[/b] On its own, it's fine.  Nothing special but keeps you chugging along.  As part of the series, it was interesting to the overall story of them, and to be on the other side of the war.

I grabbed this on sale.  If you like TDâ€™s you will like this.  Multiple towers, but not overwhelming.  Upgrades and abilities make them even better.  I found myself replaying levels to do the different difficulties or to get achievements.  Itâ€™s worth the money for sure.  A great title in its genre!

author: {'steamid': '76561198057645456', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 1945, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1945, 'last_played': 1641628860}
review:
[i]No humans allowed.But you.[/i]

This i would call a decent tower defence game with nice visuals and mechanics. Some say the franchise lost it's appeal since the idea from original games was changed(read other reviews). Well, It so happened that somehow i've played Anomaly Defenders first, so i can say nothing but "Hm, maybe?". Probably all about the perspective. No doubt i'm going to check out all the franchice and see for myself. The game was a challenge and i loved it. Some missions were indeed and painfully difficult to complete. Maybe it's about me not being familiar and skilled with TD games, yet now i think they are fun and worth playing. Every mission has 3 difficulty lvls, so you can always test out your build and experience with different tower units or skills. Loved the Engine. Everything looks pretty and nicely modeled and ballanced. There's a skill tree that allows you to create your most-liked tower and perks build making missions varriable. There's also a nicely voiced Robotic Alien AI narrator who gives you tips on missions and enemy units. And more. Check it out!

author: {'steamid': '76561198134655702', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 353, 'last_played': 1634928972}
review:
story with others is nice, for a smaller game, like this. gamplay is simple and fun, when you can play with your upgrades. Maps are nicely made with buetiful graphic on it's age

But hell come with nice thing. You will be constantly frustraited on maps with area events.

the game will laugh of your attempt to save every tower, or keep it running, but the game will say "Oh what a nice towers you have there, it would be disaster, if they were bombarded.. oh, 50% HP down, what about another one? hold on, I have much better idea, that will come after the first one. What about to give you bombardment on prepared line of defense, after 15 seconds, it will come, with my AI math, enemy will be in combat with them and your turrets have higher chance to be fu****." Maruit Dwelling is hugest shit, it made me so frustraited, that I don't want to eaven try easy diff.

anyway awsome game :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198014698888', 'num_games_owned': 924, 'num_reviews': 240, 'playtime_forever': 251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 251, 'last_played': 1633978193}
review: While the other Anomaly titles reverse the tower defense genre by making the player the attacker, Anomaly Defenders returns to a standard tower defense game. Gone are the ability to strategize unit placement and change your route on the fly. Here you can only build specific towers in the pre-defined locations. An arbitrary tech tree shows you what towers you'll be able to use in future levels but is otherwise entirely pointless. The one thing this game has apart from other tower defense games is the incessant need to Repair your towers, which honestly is not fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059649569', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 947, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 947, 'last_played': 1633850371}
review:
I bought this when 80% discount and played about 16 hours with 100% achievement unlocked.
This is a good and fun game but when I'd passed all difficulty levels it seem 'No replay value'.
---
If you would like to try this one just let me guide you a little,
1) Perks are important especially critical, buying discount and energy.
2) For functions section, You should max. Repair for AoE reparing your towers, EM Pulse is good for melt the enemies's shields. (Late game is very useful.)
3) Towers, I'd played this game just using Blaster and Enforcer with Normal Difficult until the end of the game :), so Behemoth is a good one, Scorcher is poor (Use it for doing an achievement) and Stormer only be good at 23th mission.
---
Scores = 8/10
(If you're free and looking for something to play)

author: {'steamid': '76561198041745579', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 317, 'last_played': 1632778536}
review:
[b] Survive, or die trying [/b]

This is the definition of Tactical Strategy in one. I love it when they're combined honestly.
Gives you the sense of needing to think quickly and place down the right defenses, plus there's environment effects too such as events (The meteorite map). and so forth such as the lightning map.

author: {'steamid': '76561198269451010', 'num_games_owned': 989, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 1237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1237, 'last_played': 1630766712}
review: The Visual Design of the Game makes you want to come back, feel the rush of swarming armies among your towers, blasting and using power-ups was never so satisfying, nobody should let an entire race get exterminated no matter how dangerous they are, all life is precious.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021800223', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 476, 'playtime_forever': 2260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 937, 'last_played': 1630847806}
review:
A simple yet divine Tower Defense game!

Different viable playstyles, giant elaborated technology tree and huge amount of replayability
makes this a very unique experience when comparing to other Tower Defense games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144192863', 'num_games_owned': 538, 'num_reviews': 251, 'playtime_forever': 1700, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1700, 'last_played': 1626554732}
review:
the anomaly series is a reverse tower defence game where you fight the towers instead of building them. ironically, my favorite game in the series is the one where you play as the towers in a classic tower defence fasion.
suffice to say it is great. it makes the traditional mechanics easy to understand and complex enough to play around with, as well as implementing new cool tricks at your disposal.
it has a decently lengthed campaign, but not much else from that. a heavy emphasis on changing your upgrades and technology allow for some replayability though.
all in all, 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198003333932', 'num_games_owned': 447, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1625731976}
review: If you liked the first game, you'll probably like this one too, although you're now playing a "proper" tower defense where you're the towers, so it's a 180 pivot from what you're used to.

author: {'steamid': '76561198330888468', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 507, 'playtime_forever': 374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1637497001}
review:
What appears to be a solid if less than stellar Tower Defense game. I love the genre though, so my standards can be pretty high.
Even though I am only 45 minutes in, I can see there is a nice variety of towers. Each tower has a range of tactical options, which adds a nice bit of flexibility to the play. There is also a nice tech tree that you can spend points in as you earn them, all good things. 
The look is pretty basic though, and less than exciting, which is odd because the game feels like it should be very strong in this department. 
The controls are fine, and the sound and music is nice, always a plus.
Not a fan of having to collect energy as the enemies die, but that is a minor annoyance. 
It all feels rather hastily put together though, the fluff is there, but wafer thin, a sad point as it should be the easiest thing to add to any game. 
So far there doesn't seem to be a pathing option, which usually adds to things. 
Given how poor most TD games out there these days though, it is a pleasant addition to the genre, especially as most of the best of the genre on the net vanished when Flash went away. (Sigh)
An easy thumbs up though for fans of the genre. I will probably come back and flesh this out after I have a few more hours under my belt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198320965297', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1619252920}

author: {'steamid': '76561197971584349', 'num_games_owned': 555, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 1384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1384, 'last_played': 1615767862}
review: Thumbs up and recommended, for the most part. Much anticipated "tower defense" finale for the ANOMALY "tower offense" universe. Overall quality is fine, one of the better entries for the genre, but nothing spectacular. Much better PC port than WARZONE EARTH and KOREA (with more options, including windowed mode). Stability is adequate, but not bug-free (experienced a few freezes requiring closing the game). 11 BIT STUDIOS has my attention now (thanks to FROSTPUNK and THIS WAR OF MINE), so I'm trying to go back in time to enjoy their previous efforts. My rating for ANOMALY DEFENDERS: 3 out of 5.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054676841', 'num_games_owned': 495, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 1689, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1154, 'last_played': 1616229396}
review:
Anomaly games, but, instead of attackers, you're the defenders. 
Reverse of reverse tower defense game. 
An anomaly of Anomaly game. 
A tower defense Anomaly.

Set in anomaly world, but you've been summoned by the alien. They know you showed them you're a great commander who defeat them, so they need help from you to defend their escape pod from human attacker.

Game play wise, this game are really great tower defense game. Hard level on this game are hard but not impossible to defeat with one run. You don't need to farm for technology from the later level to beat the hard difficulty, but you definitely need to run your brain to formulate best available technology combination.

Achievement wise, there's only one [i]grindy[/i] achievement to beat every level on every difficulty. I know why they put the achievement to fill the easy-normal difficulty leaderboard, but this last rarest achievement is just too much to do. The rest of it are piece of cake.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069483394', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 713, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1612113337}
review:
It is typical Tower Defense game with few upgradable towers. Hard difficulty of missions past mission 6 is insane at least when u haven't technology tree developed enough, which i don't know if is good or bad. I like mission diversity of this game - every mission looks unique, there are for example storms or falling meteorites damaging our towers. Overall good game for a while.

EDIT: just finished mission 13, it was arguably the easiest mission in game since you could just build massive amount of towers in one place near launchpad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198263316031', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 462, 'playtime_forever': 1639, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1639, 'last_played': 1610850889}
review:
Pues es un tower defense un poco del monton, es curioso porque viene de una saga que refrescaba esta formula.
Empiezas con torres sencillas y conforme avanzas en el arbol de habilidades, debloqueas torres, la posibilidad de subirlas de nivel ingame y pasivas como mas defensa o menos costo, lo normal en estos juegos. 
Yo lo deje en un punto donde te desactivan las torres, que me parece un poquito frustrante y pues la neta donde juego no quiero mas frustracion
Pero en resumen yo creo que si pasa un poquito la media, lo jugaba en horas de trabajo en una tostadora y funcionaba fluido y poco mas puedo destacar.

review:
English version below.

DerniÃ¨re partie : Mai 2020.
Contrairement aux prÃ©cÃ©dents jeux de la sÃ©rie Anomaly, il s'agit ici d'un jeu de dÃ©fense de tours classique. S'agissant de mon premier jeu du genre, je ne pourrai pas le comparer aux canons du genre, mais il semble tout Ã  fait correct. La campagne continue l'histoire commencÃ©e dans la sÃ©rie, mais vous incarnez cette fois les extraterrestres. La dÃ©fense se fait via le positionnement de diffÃ©rentes tours, qui se dÃ©bloquent le long de votre avancÃ©e. Chacune possÃ¨de des caractÃ©ristiques propres (Ã©quilibrÃ©e, longue portÃ©e, attaque de zone,...) et peut Ãªtre amÃ©liorÃ©e via un arbre de recherche qui s'Ã©toffe Ã©galement en suivant l'histoire. Il y a Ã©galement un systÃ¨me de capacitÃ©s qui peuvent Ãªtre utilisÃ©s sur les tours, de faÃ§on Ã  ajouter des effets temporaires (soins, attaque, portÃ©e,...). Le jeu dispose de trois difficultÃ©s, mais seule la plus haute reprÃ©sente un dÃ©fi : en dehors de Ã§a le jeu peut Ãªtre fini assez facilement.
CÃ´tÃ© succÃ¨s : Une partie s'obtiendra au fil de l'histoire, tandis qu'une autre partie dÃ©pendra de votre style de jeu (notamment l'usage de capacitÃ©s). Les quelques derniers vous demanderont de complÃ©ter toutes les missions dans tous les difficultÃ©s, ce qui demandera un peu de temps mais surtout un usage important de la pause active et une bonne connaissance des vagues d'ennemis.

Last played : May 2020.
Unlike previous Anomaly games, this is a classic tower defense game. Being my first of this kind, I will not be able to compare it to standards, but it seems pretty decent. The campaign continues the story started in the game serie, but this time you play as the aliens. Defense is made by placing different towers, unlocked through your progress. Each one has specific statistics (balanced, long range, area attack,...) and can be improved with a research tree which will expand with story progress too. There is also an ability system which can be used on towers, in order to add temporary effects (heal, attack, range,...). Game has three difficulties, but only the highest will be a challenge : outside of this the game can be finished quite easily.
About achievements : Some will be obtained through story, while some will depend on your play style (especially your ability usage). The last ones will need to complete all missions in all difficulties, which will require time but mostly an important usage of active pause and a good knowledge of enemy waves.

review:
[b]Epilepsy Warning.[/b]

A pretty sub-par game all around. 

However, the constant flashing lights every time you kill an enemy is aggravatingly bad. Avoid this if you have epilepsy or a low tolerance for blinding flashes every few seconds. Gets worse when you've got the game on fast forward.

If you're curious, check the videos above for an idea what to expect.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993531522', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 347, 'playtime_forever': 179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1534002513}
review:
This is a "bog-standard" tower defense game made by the same people who brought us the Anomaly Warzone Earth series. It's fairly competent overall with solid gameplay mechanics, a sound upgrade system and good optimisation overall. 

The game is certainly not bad but also brings absolutely nothing to the table with not a shred of innovation in sight. This generic nature makes the game-play feel quite pedestrian overall and frankly a little bland and unexciting compared to leaders of the genre that bring that extra spice like Defense Grid, Dungeon Warfare, Element TD, GemCraft and the Prime World: Defenders series.

Overall, it just about has enough going for it to make it worth a little dibbly-dabbly-do.

[url=https://300indiegames.blogspot.com/2020/07/tower-defense.html] Top 10 Tower Defense Games [/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198224122680', 'num_games_owned': 725, 'num_reviews': 568, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1594933536}
review:
Basically, alright.
This is an inoffensive, standard tower defense game, that doesn't venture into new territories, doesn't have unique or never before seen elements, but delivers the a fun experience with a slight difficulty curve.

The game looks fairly good, but unfortunately, this art style makes enemies hard to read, so they all feel the same. This also applies to the towers, it's difficult to make out what does what and how damage is dealt. 

The progression is fun, the upgrades slightly change the gameplay and are mostly worth getting.

The story is non-existent, although the premise would have been quite interesting. You are an alien and you fight human invaders. Unfortunately, nothing is done with the concept.

Not sure I would recommend this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041603555', 'num_games_owned': 1621, 'num_reviews': 454, 'playtime_forever': 262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 262, 'last_played': 1419142717}
review:
Anomaly Defenders in a way is a return to the game's roots... Instead of a continuation of the "tower attack" genre, Anomaly Defenders is a normal tower defense game... Except you are defending the aliens from the human invaders, who are seeking revenge against the aliens that they defeated on Earth. 

Graphics are good, but the game is nothing really special. Still there are interesting touches, like a narrative about how humans are so bloodthirsty and now they are merely fighting for their survival. It's an interesting close to the multi-game saga.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966468894', 'num_games_owned': 819, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1592284532}
review:
[Updated 2020-06-12 23:25]
So bad.

[Updated 2020-06-12]
Such a horrible game. I'm going to add that to this review every time I finish a session, until I have all the infernal achievements. This guy should be outlawed from making games.

So, so bad.

So bad.

So bad.

[Original Review]
Another horrible, built-for-phone game from this dev. (Which I will still play cuz it's probably medium-easy to get 100% achievements.)

The first Anomaly game (also a phone game) was relatively inspired, and of good technical quality. It just suffered from some QoL deficiencies.

By comparison this is boring and bland.

And really, after the innovation of the original Anomaly, I was expecting something over and above standard TD here, but it actually seems sub-par. (...A quality which will drive the irritated tone of this review.)

Like ... why "turn the genre on its head" with the reverse TD idea only to come back 2 games later with a take on the [i]original[/i] TD idea which is more bland than TD was when it was a new thing? Meanwhile 3-4 years have gone by and the original genre has evolved, if not expired. (Answer: phone game.)

Buy this game if u like:
[list][*]voiceovers explaining why and how humanity must be destroyed, which are inexplicably presented to you in English by a large-breasted cyborg .. torso.

[*]constantly being interrupted by tutorial popups by said torso, while you are trying to play the game.

[*]very-frequently being warned by that same voice that there is a massive attack incoming. the torso is a little bit of a drama queen tbh. drama torso.

[*]pretending you are tapping on a phone screen when you are clicking your mouse. cuz that's the kind of UI this game has. a phone UI. where u only ever tap one thing at a time.

[*]excessive micro. and of course there are no hotkeys so you will be tap tap tapping your way to victory! tap to build, tap to upgrade, tap to repair, tap to shield, tap tap tap to gather the macguffin-y resource you'll need in order to activate any of those powers. etc. tap!

ultimately your excellence at this game will be proven by how fast you can tap around at [i]various[/i] areas of the screen. ooh! (and, i get it: how is this so different from most games, where u constantly click around to various areas of the screen? this just has that phone game feel where that is literally [u]all[/u] that u do!)

[*]ooh almost forgot it's one of those "fun" games where beating "hard" doesn't count for beating "normal" and "easy". in 2020 this is where u facepalm.[/list]

Again, I keep asking myself, "if I was the dev who 'invented'* reverse TD, why would I do such a bland regular-TD game, later?" I do not have the answer. (*IDK if they really did or not but it's a prominent game in that category.)

Buy this only if you can handle phone-game level of simplicity and awkwardness. I'm sure I got it in some bundle so I'm not bent about paying $1 for it or whatever but still, bottom line, I think there's just much better ways to spend your time, even strictly in the TD genre. Dungeon Warfare is one of my personal faves. Shrug.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013944972', 'num_games_owned': 444, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1591286083}
review:
Ich wollte das eigentlich positiv bewerten. Naja, es ist Tower Defense.. da kann man kaum was falsch machen. Jetzt gibts das im Sale mit 80% Rabatt.

Ein paar dieser Spiele habe ich schon gespielt. Dieser Vertreter hier ist eher langweilig. Ich konnte bisher kein freies Spiel geschweige denn eine open Map finden. Man juckelt also durch die Level-Reihe. Die endlose Gegnerhorde kommt in Wellen und ist dabei keinesfalls endlos. Es ist sogar relativ schnell vorbei.. eigentlich immer zu einem Zeitpunkt wo man denkt "jetzt ist es save*.

Die Maps sehen ganz ok aus. Es gibt eigentlich immer 2-4 Wege vom Eingang zum Ziel. Die Feinde nehmen aber nur einen dieser Wege. Wenn ein zweiter Eingang vorhanden ist auch mal einen zweiten Weg. Oder sie benutzen beide den selben Weg.

Mit anderen Worten: Die Maps werden nur zu ein Drittel oder so genutzt.. die restliche FlÃ¤che ist trotz vorhandener Wege und vorhandener BauplÃ¤tze ungenutzt.

Da ich den Refund Button verpasst habe.. hege ich die Hoffnung, dass mit steigendem Schwierigkeitsgrad beim nochmaligen Durchspielen mehr Abwechslung dazu kommt. Aber ich befÃ¼rchte Monotonie..

Wirklich grausam ist, dass nicht eine open Map dabei war. Es gibt tatsÃ¤chlich Spiele die sowas bieten.. komplett leere Map auf denen man dann mit TÃ¼rmen sozusagen Wege selbst bauen kann. Suuper. Aber hier.. nicht.

author: {'steamid': '76561198825010795', 'num_games_owned': 311, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1590847178}
review:
I've been looking for a challenging tower defence game since Kingdom Rush and finally I have found what I've been looking for!

+ The tech tree's dept is the gem of this game.
+ Fast paced
+ Level of hardness is well balanced
+ Great sound
+ Great graphics even for "low" quality (my laptop doesn't have a dedicated graphic card so this is important!)
+ Doesn't require much

- A longer story would be better but still, I's fun! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197995374233', 'num_games_owned': 482, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 635, 'last_played': 1589359849}
review:
A fitting end to an excellent series, Defenders is a conventional but fun tower defence game.  If you've played the previous games and wished you could have those annoying scorcher towers... now you can.  It loses the original reverse-defence mechanic, so it's not doing anything that previous tower games haven't... but it does it smoothly with a well designed tech tree.

If you're new to tower defence, it may be better to start elsewhere.  But if you've played a couple of Anomaly games already and you'd like to be the aliens for a change... this is a good way to finish off.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995749658', 'num_games_owned': 1958, 'num_reviews': 1565, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1589011467}

author: {'steamid': '76561198004226735', 'num_games_owned': 636, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 4833, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4833, 'last_played': 1587548316}
review:
Anomaly Defenders is a decent game and I found it enjoyable as you get the chance to play with the Anomaly units from the alien POV. It is not quite so polished as previous Anomaly games, it felt quite a bit short and there is no story.

Even though this game uses Anomaly 2 engine and assets (and it does look great ingame), the interface looks bad.

There are three difficulties in this game, they differ not only by the sheer number of enemies, but also by different map layouts. There are some with unique mechanics, which force you to use different strategies (which is always good to have).
However, the tech tree can make these mechanics irrelevant: by using an optimal build, you can ignore anything else by just grinding tech points instead of thinking of a strategy.

Overall, Anomaly Defenders is still a solid TD if you play at the hard difficulty, where you will get some real challenge. 
However, there is no story, and you will probably become annoyed near the end of the game since it becomes pretty repetitive.
If you are a fan of Anomaly or Tower defense games in general, grab this game during a Steam sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998815819', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 718, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 718, 'last_played': 1588828901}
review:
This game was the okay-iest tower defense game I've ever played.

[h1]The Okay:[/h1]
- The enemy units and towers were the same from the previous Anomaly games, which was nice
- The tech tree allowed you to re-spec at any time, leaving the optimal strategy up to you
- The game's volumes didn't default to 100% on first launch, a somewhat rare thing
- Most levels had meaningful choices of where to place towers, didn't pigeonhole you

[h1]The Bad:[/h1]
- The levels kinda felt samey in their visual design
- Tech tree is not quite so flexible as it first appears, since there are a few 'must have' technologies
- Could not rotate camera, for seemingly no real reason - some tower locations were harder to see because of this
- No REAL story, which is weird, coming from the previous anomaly games

[h1]The Ugly:[/h1]
- Very frequent flashing of nearly the full screen on kills, with no way to disable this.
- There is an achievement that requires you to beat every level on EVERY difficulty : harder difficulties don't count for easier difficulties -- annoying and tedious for those who like getting all achievements
- Way too much micromanagement of buying/selling & using abilities

[h1]The TL;DR:[/h1]
I don't recommend buying this game unless you're either a huge tower defense fan, a huge Anomaly series fan, or ideally, both.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010023963', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 3864, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2439, 'last_played': 1589000076}
review:
Highly recommended! Anomaly Defenders is the fifth & final game in the Anomaly series. This time the series brings you back to the grass roots of the Tower Defense genre, you play as the aliens, defending against the human invaders. The usual alien towers and human armoured vehicles are back. The game is beautiful to look at too!

Although the game's description says there are 24 missions, note that at varying difficulties, each mission's map changes slightly.... so if one is feeling generous, you could say there are actually 72 missions :-)

The only quirky criticism I have is that unlike the previous Anomaly games, the story narrative in this game is mediocre at best. Who is the AI that recruited you? Why does she have a convenient humanoid figure with big beautiful breasts? Why do the humans have this genocidal urge to exterminate the aliens? Was there no attempt at brokering peace? How did the humans get the technology and materiel necessary to travel across the galaxy to invade the aliens, especially given the state of the planet Earth and the human race back in Anomaly 2? All these details are non-existent!!!

Notwithstanding the awful plot-holes.... for $10 this is a fantastic game. If you are a Tower Defense fan and you are a completionist who likes obtaining every game achievement possible, plus you've played & loved the previous games in the series, you'll easily accumulate at least 40 hours of gaming time. Great value!

BONUS: There are no micro-transactions or non-fungible tokens (NFTs) in this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198008057192', 'num_games_owned': 188, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1588467412}
review: This is not a strategy based TD game. The enemy travels on a predefined route that you can only affect by building a gathering station at a predefined location. There are predefined turret or gun placements so you don't have any flexibility for where you can place your turrets. The only strategy involved is deciding which turret to place on the predefined mount location. Then, it's simply a matter of keeping them repaired while the AI walks along the route, attacking your turrets. If you're looking for something similar to Defense Grid, keep looking. If you want a simple, no thought involved TD game where you simply place towers and watch the action while clicking repair, this is for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11207, 'playtime_forever': 228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1588521376}
review:
Anomaly Defenders is a top down tower defense game with a sci-fi theme.   Build towers on fixed hardpoints on the map, upgrade them and repair them as they take damage. 

The key problem here is that they are attempting to make a tower defense game that looks good, features 3D graphics, and escapes from the mobile/console gaming reputation that hangs around tower defense games like a bad smell.   Unfortunately the developers didn't bother adding support for resolutions over 1440p, which is a glaring deficiency.   A lot of potential thrown out the window because the devs couldn't be bothered thinking about the PC platform.

review:
Allein dafÃ¼r, dass man jeden Schwierigkeitsgrad durchspielen muss, auch wenn man das Spiel auf der hÃ¶chsten Schwierigkeit abgeschlossen hat gibt einen dicken Minuspunkt. Ansonsten nettes kleines Tower Defence Game.

Pro:
- SchÃ¶ner Techbaum
- Abwechslung in 24 Karten

Kontra:
- Jede Schwierigkeit fÃ¼r Erfolge erforderlich...
- Schwierigkeit ist nicht ausbalanciert
- Plattformen richten TÃ¼rme in eine feste Richtung ausgerichtet

Ein kleines Spiel fÃ¼r zwischendurch. DafÃ¼r ist es okay (auch wenn man fÃ¼r die letzten Karten auf schwer ruhig 30 Minuten einplanen kann :D) Aber wie oben beschrieben, warum muss ich einfach und normal nochmal durchspielen, wenn ich das Spiel auf schwer abgeschlossen habe? Die Level sind zwar abwechslungsreich, aber nicht nach Schwierigkeit sortiert. Z.B. Level 22 - 4 Wege und Luftangriffe und alle Plattformen sind so ausgerichtet, dass bis die TÃ¼rme sich gedreht haben, um die von hinten ankommenden Lufteinheiten zu zerstÃ¶ren, meist selbst schon kaputt sind... Level 23 ist dafÃ¼r dann so einfach, dass man mit Ã¼ber 50.000 WÃ¤hrung rausgeht. Ansonsten ist die Schwierigkeit okay, man muss schauen, aber es ist schaffbar.

FÃ¼r ErfolgsjÃ¤ger:

author: {'steamid': '76561197996919908', 'num_games_owned': 1532, 'num_reviews': 875, 'playtime_forever': 1105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1105, 'last_played': 1444567412}
review:
[h1]Seitenwechsel [/h1]

Wenn man durch die ganze â€œAnomalyâ€ Reihe gespielt hat, denkt man sich vielleicht: â€œHey, vielleicht mal wieder ein normales Tower-Defense, ohne dass ich die Gegenseite spieleâ€¦â€. Eure WÃ¼nsche wurden erhÃ¶rt.

[b]Gameplay[/b]
â€œAnomaly: Defendersâ€ dreht, wie der Name schon sagt, den SpieÃŸ um und lÃ¤sst uns eine gewÃ¶hnliche Tower-Defense spielen, die sich natÃ¼rlich an den Einheiten der Spielreihe orientiert. So dÃ¼rfen wir mit TÃ¼rmen wie dem â€œScorcherâ€ den menschlichen Feinden ordentlich einheizen. Diese verfÃ¼gen allerdings nicht Ã¼ber die Einheiten der VorgÃ¤nger, sondern Ã¼ber viele kleinere und schwÃ¤chere Truppen. Zwischen den Runden kÃ¶nnen die TÃ¼rme mit erworbenen FÃ¤higkeitspunkten verbessert werden. Auch damit bleibt das Spiel aber angenehm gebalanced, aber vielleicht auch ein wenig einfach. TatsÃ¤chlich wollte ich mal alle Achievements sammeln, jedoch muss man das Spiel dafÃ¼r ernsthaft auf allen drei Schwierigkeitsgraden durchspielen, wobei ich das Spiel bereits auf â€œSchwerâ€ beim ersten Mal geschafft habe. Aber sonst gibt es nicht viel zu beanstanen.

[b]Story[/b]
Nachdem unser Commander am Ende des zweiten Teils (eventuell) ein wenig Sympathie fÃ¼r die Aliens aufbringen konnte, wurde er nun fÃ¼r die Verteidigung ihrer eigenen Welt auserkoren. Denn wie Menschen so sind, wenn man ihren Planeten annektieren mÃ¶chte, wollen die Primaten jetzt Rache nehmen. Ansonsten bleibt die Geschichte jedoch zu den VorgÃ¤ngern sehr seicht und ist eigentlich nicht wirklich vorhanden. Eigentlich schade.

[b]Grafik/Sound[/b]
Das Spiel ist vermutlich durch die VerÃ¶ffentlichung auf mobilen GerÃ¤ten etwas abgespeckt. Es sieht zwar dennoch ganz ok aus, doch merkt man die fehlende Kulisse und verhÃ¤ltnismÃ¤ÃŸig einfachen Animationen. Soundtechnisch gibt einem das Spiel einen Remix an die Hand, der irgendwie â€spacigâ€œ klingt. Grafisch ist es auf jeden Fall nicht mit dem zweiten Teil vergleichbar, was natÃ¼rlich auch daran liegt, dass dieser Titel nun wieder fÃ¼r mobile GerÃ¤te konzipiert wurde.

[b]Fazit[/b]
â€Anomaly Defendersâ€œ ist ein schÃ¶nes Tower-Defense, wie ich es irgendwie am Ende der Reihe kommen habe sehen. Leider kommt es nicht an die Geschichte und Technik der VorgÃ¤nger heran.Wer aber die VorgÃ¤nger schon gespielt hat, wird sich dieses Spiel aber vermutlich nicht entgehen lassen. SchlieÃŸlich hat man hier die Gelegenheit, endlich mal die andere Seite zu spielen. 


Was haben Menschen und Aliens scheinbar gemeinsam? Na, sie â€towernâ€œ gerne! Ok, der Witz war echt schlecht, aber Gott sei Dank schreibe ich eh lieber Reviews. FÃ¼r Mehr davon kannst du mir [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/Drakeschool] hier[/url] folgen!

author: {'steamid': '76561197983710207', 'num_games_owned': 391, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1451, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1451, 'last_played': 1585757982}
review:
Ich habe dieses Game fÃ¼r ein paar Cent in einem Sale erworben und muss sagen ich war sehr positiv Ã¼berrascht :)

Es ist ein rundum gelungenes Tower Defense Spiel nach dem klassischen Schere-Stein-Papier Prinzip. Das Spiel bietet drei Schwierigkeitsgrade wodurch man auch einige Zeit beschÃ¤ftigt ist. Dies wird abgerundet mit einer wirklich sehr guten Grafik fÃ¼r dieses Genre. Allerdings gibt es hier und da einige Ãœbersetzungsfehler, was aber nicht weiter stÃ¶rt. Bugs oder AbstÃ¼rze hatte ich keine (oder sie sind mir nicht aufgefallen :P).

Die Spielzeit belief sich bei mir nach einem Durchlauf auf allen Schwierigkeitsgraden auf ca. 24 Stunden.

Alles in allem war es fÃ¼r mich das beste Tower Defense Game das ich in letzter Zeit gespielt habe, klare Kaufempfehlung :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198024697635', 'num_games_owned': 673, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 898, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 532, 'last_played': 1654050514}
review: Simple tower defense game with a simple meta game perfectly executed. If you like tower defense, you'll enjoy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198814512162', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1583543389}
review: Really enjoy this game! I played a ton of browser tower defense games when I was younger and realized how much I missed them right after I started. It's got a pretty crazy pace to it once the game gets going. It's way more than just set up your units and let the level go! constant interaction during each wave. The only thing I wish I had control over is when the next wave starts. It starts automatically and if you have the fast-forward button on like I normally do there isn't much time between rounds to get your units set up. Overall though if you are looking for a bit more than your traditional Tower Defense then this game could be for you!

author: {'steamid': '76561197989094213', 'num_games_owned': 641, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1582599096}
review: Looks good, interface is simple enough to understand, it looks like some of the upgrade options could lead to some interesting defense builds, HOWEVER: After completing the first two levels, every time I tried the third level the game would crash the instant the first wave spawned. Tried different difficulties & various things to try and fix it, but nothing helped. For this reason alone I simply can't recommend it as I was denied the chance to play the rest of the game. :(

author: {'steamid': '76561198068102627', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 699, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 618, 'last_played': 1596487573}
review:
Its a mobile port and it shows. Not by disfunctionality but by annoying mechanics like clicking to receive energy instead of getting it automatically. Generally requires lots of micromanaging. You can pause to command but then level takes ages. Some enemies are defeated by reaching the launchpad (Base) and its forcefield. Heads-Up: Abilities are very important but require lots of actions to use them effective consistently. Its pretty annoying to get your towers frequently destroyed or disabled anyways, despite having surplus cash.
Which is a shame because voiceacting, music, upgrade tree, diverting the routes of enemies are quite fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034303835', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 212, 'playtime_forever': 2280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2280, 'last_played': 1579737767}
review:
[i]Anomaly Defenders[/i] est un jeu de tower defense oÃ¹ l'on incarne une civilisation extraterrestre devant repousser une invasion humaine. 

On retrouve ici tout ce qu'il y a de plus classique pour un jeu de ce type. En effet, il y a une assez grande variÃ©tÃ© de tourelles (8 tourelles de combat au total sans compter la tour de collecte des ressources), comportant chacune des forces et des faiblesses en fonction des ennemis. Il y a Ã©galement des amÃ©liorations Ã  dÃ©bloquer au cours de la campagne via un arbre technologique que l'on peut rÃ©initialiser Ã  tout moment (augmentation des dÃ©gÃ¢ts des diffÃ©rentes tourelles, rÃ©duction du coÃ»t des tours, capacitÃ©s spÃ©ciales Ã  utiliser, etc.). Bon placement et amÃ©lioration de vos tourelles seront ainsi les clÃ©s de la rÃ©ussite, comme dans tout tower defense qui se respecte.

La durÃ©e de vie de la campagne est par ailleurs plutÃ´t bonne (une trentaine d'heure en mode difficile) et l'on prend plaisir Ã  enchaÃ®ner les missions sans lassitude. Les graphismes sont corrects et le jeu est bien optimisÃ© (aucun crash rencontrÃ©), le tout pour un tout petit prix (environ 1â‚¬ en soldes). On peut alors dire qu'[i]Anomaly Defenders[/i] remplit plutÃ´t bien son rÃ´le.

Cependant, ce jeu n'est pas exempt de dÃ©fauts. On peut notamment lui reprocher un manque d'originalitÃ© car il ne propose rien de vraiment novateur ni de rÃ©volutionnaire pour un tower defense. Mais surtout, son principal dÃ©faut est, Ã  mes yeux, que trÃ¨s peu de tourelles sont rÃ©ellement utiles, la majoritÃ© de celles-ci Ã©tant onÃ©reuses, inefficaces et superflues.

Il apparaÃ®t effectivement que la seule tourelle de base (tourelle "Blaster") est tellement polyvalente et performante contre quasiment tous les ennemis (hormis ceux ayant un bouclier) qu'elle permet de se passer totalement des autres tours. Il suffit juste de l'amÃ©liorer au niveau maximum, de l'associer Ã  une tourelle anti-bouclier (qui comble sa seule faiblesse) ainsi qu'Ã  une tourelle de boost (tourelle "FantÃ´me") qui va augmenter sa portÃ©e et ses dÃ©gÃ¢ts, pour rÃ©ussir Ã  finir, assez aisÃ©ment, la campagne en difficultÃ© maximale. Je trouve donc un peu regrettable de n'utiliser que trÃ¨s partiellement l'arsenal dont on dispose.

MalgrÃ© cela, je vous conseille d'acheter ce jeu car, mÃªme s'il manque d'originalitÃ© et a quelques petits dÃ©fauts, il reste tout de mÃªme un bon tower defense avec une durÃ©e de vie satisfaisante et un bon rapport qualitÃ©/prix.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052903702', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4422, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3168, 'last_played': 1626242423}
review: True to the tower defense tradition, this game is a challenge.  It's well constructed - excellent visuals as relate to gameplay - a variety of tower types and upgrades permit variety in the construction of your base defenses.  The story line, as well as the mode of play, mesh well with the other Defender series.  Nice job.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000958324', 'num_games_owned': 923, 'num_reviews': 208, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1570795170}
review:
It's a great tower defence.

I don't get the story though. The human hero suddenly siding with the aliens? Lazy wrighting.

However even if the game is polished, and the mechanics works great, i tend to get bored when there is so little variation to the game. So i will problably not beat this one due to pure boredom with the limited content.

author: {'steamid': '76561198267906374', 'num_games_owned': 776, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 619, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1699986453}

author: {'steamid': '76561198173869566', 'num_games_owned': 677, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 479, 'last_played': 1563461268}
review:
- Claustrophobic maps...
- Non existant strategy factor... just build whatever and wherever... towers die in seconds anyway...
- Balance is crap... You end up constantly repairing your towers since wave 2... and starve for energy till the end of the map... or your base...
- And there's this genius lightning... hitting every few seconds... at the same spot... powering down your towers...

Enough of this nonsense...
Want a good tower defence? Go back to gemcraft...
This one's a waste of time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004668614', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 475, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 475, 'last_played': 1560643419}
review:
It's tower defense, so in broad strokes you aren't going to see anything amazingly different from other games of this type. It does do several nice things, though: gives you some freedom of choice for upgrading, gives you a modest degree of being able to steer the enemy forces into your hottest fire zones, and the graphics are pretty nice as well.

The plot is also an interesting choice: you're the commander of an alien species being invaded by humanity, and you're fighting the rearguard action so that people can escape. Usually it's the other way around, but it helps explain the supertech niftiness of your defense turrets. 

If you like tower defense games, you won't be disappointed here.

review:
Recommended only at high discount or bundle price.
As far as Tower Defense games go, this isn't bad.
But considering the fact that you can find pretty decent free browser games like this, the regular price is too high.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000378204', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 1480, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1480, 'last_played': 1443033106}
review:
A very nice tower defense, but nothing new either.

I'm usually not into tower defense games, but I really liked the Anomaly games, so I tried this one and found myself pretty much engrossed in it.

Not too long, which is a nice thing in my opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198289778406', 'num_games_owned': 644, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1609439569}

author: {'steamid': '76561198093853239', 'num_games_owned': 526, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 499, 'last_played': 1557709736}
review:
The first games in this series was fantastic to play as it was as the games' stated "Reversed Tower Defense". But seeing as this particular game is indeed a return to the "standard" tower defense formula it just fell short. For one thing, the technology mechanic may be interesting at first but it ultimately becomes to cumbersome and not so helpful. Instead of locking better towers as you get further in the campaign, the game just unlocks "powerups" that may or may not be particularly useful in the current mission you're on. Like giving you those stupid 
Predator" towers that are supposed to be useful against shielded enemies. Then instead of being useful, these things do diddlysquat on the following mission afterwards. I'm currently stuck on the 14th mission because the game isn't fun to play anymore. And to think I really enjoyed Anomaly Warzone Earth, Anomaly 2, Korea as well as the "Mobile Campaigns" iterations. But Defenders, a hard pass for me. My only consolation for now is I've at least collected the entire franchise.

author: {'steamid': '76561198273011256', 'num_games_owned': 3040, 'num_reviews': 715, 'playtime_forever': 976, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 975, 'last_played': 1550489987}
review:
[h1]Bueno, Bonito, Barato; sencillo y divertido~â™¥[/h1]

Siendo mi primer acercamiento a la "franquicia" Anomaly pues fue uno muy bueno.

>A grandes rasgos:
Este titulo es un tower defense en el que encarnamos a un comandante que es "raptado" por una alien waifu, que te pide ayuda para intervenir en la lucha vs los humanos... para que ellos puedan escapar del holocausto alien hospiciado por los terranos(porque al parecer son una raza pacifica y los humanos unos ogts... como en la vida real).

>Lo bueno:
-Desde ya: el soundtrack es la mitad del juego xD muy epico y hermoso la verdad con apenas 4-5 melodias te da un orgasmo auditivo 10/10
-El gameplay: es de los tower defense mas amigables que he visto... ojo que igual tiene su chiste y dificultad pero es simple y no tan complejo como otros (cof cof Defense Gryd)
-La campaÃ±a esta decente, son 24 misiones que puedes pasar en 3 dificultades (noob, normal y hard) lo que te da para 5-6hrs por run... unas 18 horas de gameplay total si buscas sacar todo.

>Lo malo:
-pues... tal vez que no innova mucho; es un tower defense en toda regla. No hay cosas que meta de mÃ¡s xD
-Falto un modo "standar" donde tengas mapitas predeterminados para tener batallas... en mi opinion.

[h1]Resumiendo:[/h1]
Pues... es un juego casual que hace su cometido: entretener. Puedes acabarlo en una tarde de una sentada 7u7 como io~â™¥ 
Como tower defense es un solido 6/10 por su simpleza... para mi es un 7/10 por la hermosisima banda sonora que tiene, te hace sentir heroico y pues que me entretuvo... eso es un logro con la vasta cantidad de juegos mediocres-malos que pululan hoy en dia.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037914112', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 955, 'last_played': 1544989395}
review:
Played everything up to the boss level in two days. Did not try the boss level yet. Crashed only once during a mission.

At first i didnt want to buy it because it looks more like a C&C game, but it does the trick for me. Normal tower defense games are not attractive to play but this one is. I suppose that not being able to zoom out is a feature to make it harder to win the bigger maps. It was not a problem since you can pause the game between strikes and so you can navigate over the complete map. I didnt find any negative about the game. Really worth buying for a no-brainer evening!

Certains bonus viendront agrÃ©menter votre stratÃ©gie, mais rien qui sorte du cadre d'un tower defense.

LÃ  oÃ¹ c'est agrÃ©able, c 'est que c'est dans l'univers Anomaly, si vous avez jouÃ© Ã  la saga, c'est rigolo de prendre la place des aliens pour dÃ©fendre leur territoire au lieu d'Ãªtre l'envahisseur.
Une bonne durÃ©e de vie pour ce jeu, un challenge sur certaines maps en difficultÃ© maximale, heureusement, il y a une pause active qui permet de planifier ses coups.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008332774', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 468, 'playtime_forever': 402, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 402, 'last_played': 1540575221}
review:
Pretty decent tower defense game. All the previous Anomaly titles from this developer were Tower Offense games and it was fun to see how they managed to make a classic TD style game. 

Overall, I think they succeeded at that.

There aren't a lot of different towers, but the tech tree and several abilities which can boost towers' attack speed/range allows you to try different playstyles. Although on harder levels you don't really have much room for experimentation, because you need to be very efficient and there are not a lot of places where you can put towers on too.

There is no story in this one. Only simple objective - defend the launchpad. 24 missions.

The gameplay is fluent, graphics are good, music too. But why did they make the screen blink when you kill a unit...I don't know. At first it can really make you feel dizzy or nauseous. Apart from that, everything is quite good.

You can complete the whole playthrough on easy difficulty in 6.5h. If you want to get all achievements you will need to triple your playing time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068141034', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 235, 'last_played': 1540927482}
review:
Awwwwww, four hours in and its over. I really enjoyed playing this. 

Anomaly Defenders is a gorgeous TD game, the visuals are in a diffrent galaxy to most TDs, a nice 3D top down(ish) view which you can zoom close enough to see the workings of the creeps, some of them look like ED-209 out of Robocop. 

There's a kind of... basic but involved thing going on with AD, there are three different ways of boosting your towers' DPS, speed, and range: invest in skills from the tech tree; use support towers; or use boosts during play which are gained with 'energy' you get from killing creeps. 

The game is also about the right tower for the creeps, some towers are better at smakking mechs, some better at air, some better with electrical shields, etc. although this doesn't mean you sell and rebuild during play, you prety much have to balance your offencive layout to cater for all. There are broadly speaking two sets of towers, the ones you get early in the game, and later better versions of them which unlock later on. 

The creeps can fire back in this, or really, they're on the offensive from the start and more than willing to open fire. This adds a fairly basic but sometimes tricky element of hiding your towers behind objects, or behind stronger towers. 

There are also resources, you place a mining thingy which generates really a lot of stuff for you to spend on towers and upgrades, but also, these mining thingys are a big attraction for the creeps and you can use the mining thingy to alter the paths taken by creeps. That's.... that's strategy, for sure, but not very involved. I mean, some maps could have been made so that you would have to mine the stuff one area at a time, you know, sell up your towers and move everything in order to mine another area, but its not like that. Almost all of the areas, you can put the mining thingys whre they can go, and set up your towers at the earliest place to get a good smackown on the creeps, and that's that,  you can keep your mining thingy in place, even when its depeleted the area, and the creeps stay on course for it, so you never have to change your layout. The route-changing thing is pretty cool, but I didn't think it was really played to the depth it could have been. 

Toward the end-game the maps get a bit big, and places to put your towers a bit restrictive, and I did find that I had to use the pause game feature to apply changes. Things get really hectic. This is the part of the game which reeeally sucks you in, playing in the later stages can leave you feeling wired and stretched, ya know, TDs are rarely that exhilerating, although there is a sort of similarity more with whack-a-mole than other TDs in that you're picking up energy from dead creeps and applying it to repair towers as their armor goes down. 

There's a lovely voiceover, a bot/mech type female voice. Not human enough to be hot, but really cute in its own way. She's all like, 'It's an honor to watch you work, Commander,' and I'm all like, awwwww, shucks :) 

The visuals are really stunning, this glowy other worldy stuff playing out, that's what really makes this game, cuz while the TD works, and it doesn't get insanely difficult or hold you to endless replaying of previous maps to get the skills to progress, its a lot more user friendly than the big games in this genre, but... its very short. I didn't realise the full price was close to ten pounds. That's... kind of appalling really, I mean if this had crappy graphics it would be free to play on Kongregate, and even then it would probably be shorter than some of the demos found there. 

On sale, I'd say, its about right. A good game these days will keep you occupied for anywhere between fifty and three thousand hours, so this beautiful little 4 hour distraction should only be a pound or so. 

Very much recommended lovely looking and casual TD game, when its on sale.

review:
Game is not bad. 6/10
this is the ONLY game a beat on 100% and got ALL the achievements. The reason - it pis-sed me by insulting my intelect.
Whoever design maps should learn how defense building works.
Its NOT posting bunker in the most BS terrain, but buiulding it in the most effective place.
Devs should take a short break from overthinking how to make player swear more in 10 minuites than for rest of thier lifes with this idiotic mount layuout.

All except map making is good.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970739339', 'num_games_owned': 676, 'num_reviews': 564, 'playtime_forever': 219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1538348205}
review:
Defenders is the third and final main installment in the Anomaly series, and flips the player's perspective to the aliens- now on the defense on their own homeworld against counterattacking human forces. Except you're a human commander they've asked for help or something? I don't know, the writing is nonexistant and the only voiceover is your helper AI.

Defenders is a traditional tower defense, as opposed to the earlier games. You now have control of the alien towers that were hounding you through the rest of the series, and can upgrade them and have them use timed abilities. Of course, they're no where near as tough as they were when you were fighting them. And the inverse is now true for the attacking enemy units. Go figure. 

Thankfully the AI is dumb and doesn't use support abilities, though the enemies do occasionally morph. You also have access to a tactical pause function that enables you to issue ability orders, and make tower and upgrade purchases, much more robust then the glorified mapquest app of the earlier games.

Defenders is easily the best game in the franchise, but that still kind of isn't saying much. If steam had a "thumbs sideways" option, I would give the entire franchise a resounding "meh", and no offense to its devs. But I have made worse one dollar purchases.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062813911', 'num_games_owned': 1958, 'num_reviews': 2050, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1537841379}
review:
[h1] DISCLAIMER: This is a first impressions review, and NOT a full review [/h1]

Anomaly Defenders is a game developed and published by 11 Bit Studios, the same people behind the Anomaly series, This War of Mine and Frostpunk

Anomaly Defenders is considered to be (I think) the third in a line up of great sci-fi/action/strategy games by 11 Bit Studios

You plan your route carefully with planning and thought, after you get to choose the loadout of vehicles you wish, after you try and survive the terrors of the alien lifeforms which has taken over Baghdad and other ares round that part

Overall it makes me feel like I am playing a tower defense game, but instead of planning to defend whatever I need, I am actually moving through, while the alien lifeforms is planning its way on defending either its power cores or just trying to ruin your day by just shooting you non-stop 

Overall the graphics and music are great, the voice acting is good and the story is actually quite a good story, kinda weird as I was just expecting soldiers trying to move their way through either a group of terrorists or shooting their way through to get out of Korea, like Homefront and such

The game is great, short, but challenging as you may die a lot for poor planning, but thankfully their is a good checkpoint system where if you die or want to start over again, you can just start from the checkpoint. A great game in the long line up from 11 Bit Studios!

[h1] RECOMMENDED :) [/h1]

[b] REVIEW SOURCES: [/b]
[list]
[*] None

author: {'steamid': '76561197982260083', 'num_games_owned': 1336, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 544, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 544, 'last_played': 1534335441}
review:
This game was probably made for mobile with a huge UI and on screen droppable "Energy" that you have to click to collect. I prefer this over the inverse tower defense they're known for, because this does fair justice to the td genre.
It's also very crowded to the point where you can not properly select a tower then the huge UI appears and had me sell towers by mistake at times or upgrade some I didn't want to. There is a big variety of upgrades for passives and towers but few of those prove actually useful, out of all towers, I used probably 4-5 through my campaign because the others would be really weak for their purpose or just get destroyed by enemies in 1 shot. Also powers like Rage, Sniper, and a few other passives I've never got to use or felt underwhelming compared to just repairing the tower and upgrading its firepower.
I enjoyed it until level 10 I think where you get some randomized events they say like storms or meteors that damage your towers and enemy units or just puts them out of use for a period of time but somehow those storm or meteors mostly happened where I had towers built making it not so random but a pain in the ass and not affecting the enemies as much.
Later in the game you'll also get airborne units that do not follow the normal paths but survey the map in different patterns and so you have to prepare differently for those even if you've set your towers along a certain road
Bottom line is that it would've been a great tower defense without the outside storms and meteors, without the random airborne units paths, without all the on screen clutter created from the effects and explosions and with some proper balance
